==23260== Memcheck, a memory error detector
==23260== Copyright (C) 2002-2017, and GNU GPL'd, by Julian Seward et al.
==23260== Using Valgrind-3.14.0 and LibVEX; rerun with -h for copyright info
==23260== Command: ./shakespeare_snippet 1 null null live
==23260== 

Shakespeare Data:
Title: Sonnet 148
Type: poem
Text: O me! what eyes hath love put in my head,
 Which have no correspondence with true sight,
 Or if they have, where is my judgment fled,
 That censures falsely what they see aright?
 If that be fair whereon my false eyes dote,
 What means the world to say it is not so?
 If it be not, then love doth well denote,
 Love's eye is not so true as all men's: no,
 How can it? O how can love's eye be true,
 That is so vexed with watching and with tears?
 No marvel then though I mistake my view,
 The sun it self sees not, till heaven clears.
 O cunning love, with tears thou keep'st me blind,
 Lest eyes well-seeing thy foul faults should find.
==23260==

==23260==     in use at exit: 72,896 bytes in 13 blocks

==23260==    indirectly lost: 0 bytes in 0 blocks
==23260==      possibly lost: 0 bytes in 0 blocks
==23260==    still reachable: 0 bytes in 0 blocks
==23260==         suppressed: 72,896 bytes in 13 blocks

Title: Harder, Better, Faster, Stronger
Artist: Daft Punk
Album: Discovery
Release Date: 2001-02-26

Do it, makes us
Harder, better
Faster, stronger
More than, hour
Hour, never
Ever, after
Work is, over

Do it, makes us
Harder, better
Faster, stronger

Work it harder, make it better
Do it faster, makes us stronger
More than ever, hour after hour
Work is never over

Do it faster, makes us stronger
More than ever, hour after hour

More than ever, hour after hour

Do it faster
More than ever, hour
Work is never over
Work it harder, make it better
Do it faster, makes us stronger
More than ever, hour after hour
Work is never over
